speaker: Final Arena
line: The floor is scored with old circles—ritual marks, duel marks, and the impatient scratches of people who waited too long for an answer.

speaker: Hollow King
line: All your paths converge here. You’ve collected vows like coins. Tell me: will you spend them, or hoard them until they rot?

choices.text: Parley. I want terms that don’t require kneeling.
Defy. I won’t accept a throne built from fear.
Ask why he built the Hollow.

speaker: Hollow King
line: Because people begged for someone to decide. They called it peace. I called it efficiency.

speaker: Hollow King
line: Then here is the truth: the world will always build cages. The only question is whether you pretend they’re homes.

speaker: Hollow King
line: Parley, then. Say what you intend to do with authority if you survive this day.

speaker: Hollow King
line: Your intent is a map. Speak it.

choices.text: Restore balance—leave room for people to choose.
Rule—if law is inevitable, let it be mine.

speaker: Final Arena
line: The arena waits. Not for violence—for decision.
